data.name: deviantart dark/monochrome theme
data.description:
this theme is for the website deviantart. it is a dark/monochromish theme. i have created this theme for my own personal use because i can't find any decent dark/gothic themes that work with the new deviantart. THIS IS A BETA THEME AND IS NOT GUARANTEED TO WORK PROPERLY!!

NOTE: This theme is currently broken and does NOT work with Eclipse! I will make it work with Eclipse soon.

data.name: ayu-rs (dark theme)
data.description:
Gorgeous dark theme for various Rust websites. Please see the Github repo for details on setting up the Rust playground theme correctly and the preferred installation method (directly with Stylus). Sites supported:
  • docs.rs
  • crates.io
  • play.rust-lang.org
  • play.integer32.com
  • this-week-in-rust.org

data.name: Instagram Removed login requirement
data.description:
This skin removes login requirement when scrolling in a profile, but with a recent change you can only view pictures (without account) with the middle mouse button

WARNING - it messes with scroll behavior and pop-ups when logged-in

data.name: thingiverse - anti-eyeburnout
data.description: I HATE white pages. They always burn my eyes out after switching over from a dark site. This might help. Use at your own risk.

user.name: Timothy Cole
user.about:
My name is Timothy Cole or as my parents refer to me, tech support but you can call me Tim!

I'm a 21 year old, self-taught, full-stack web developer living on the coastal side of North Carolina.

When I was 10 years old I fell in love with computers. I thought they were so neat that I wanted to become the CEO of Intel one day! When I was 13 I realized how intriguing websites are so I started to tinker with inspect element. It wasn't until then when I realized what I wanted to do with my life. A few months passed and I was still learning and investing my time away.

EUREKA! - Finally, by the age of 14, I created my very first website! All front-end and far from perfect, but it was mine that's all that mattered. As time passed, I completed many projects, gradually becoming more educated and working harder as ever.

After hating school for my entire life, when I was 17 in freshmen year, I decided to drop out to pursue my career as a web developer.

Now I'm fluent in CSS, HTML, JS, Golang, NodeJS, and PHP with a touch of Python and Java (Android Development), currently working as QA and Development at SocialBlade.
